result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean Allen Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 6 months County Jail,  Good time and Huber Privileges.  165 days credit. - TIME SERVED
$518.00  including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. Pay obligation within 30 days or apply for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
1:47 PM Defendant Dean Allen Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Dean Allen Johnson.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court addresses the DEF on attorney appearing by video, DEF agrees to proceed.   State recites agreement, all parties agree.   Court moves to waiver of preliminary hearing and arraignment.   Court reviews the information being filed by State,  DEF enters NC Plea to Count 1.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty to Count 1.   Counts 2  is dismissed and read in.   State makes statement prior to statement, request to follow proposal.  Attny Gill makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF makes statement to court.  Court has discussion with DEF.   Court to follow agreement.  

COURT:  6 Months County Jail, Good time and Huber Privileges.  165 Days credit.   Time Served.   Court Costs.  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge.

11:33 AM  Defendant Dean Allen Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Gill indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State requests the court to take judicial notice of bond in Case 22CF71, Court takes judicial notice.  State calls witness, LCO Officer Ian Junker, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.    11:37 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State tenders witness.   11:38 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Gill.   11:39 State objection, relevance,  Court sustained.  Attny Gill continues cross.  No further witness by either party.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.    Attny Gill indicates if State to file information mirroring criminal complaint, arraignment can be handled today.  State requests to handle arraignment at later date.  Court sets.  

Attny Gill request bond modification.  State objects bond modification.  Court denies modification of bond.
